name: OxiCleanarr Bridge
description: Jellyfin plugin for OxiCleanarr integration. Manages symlinks via HTTP API. The power of OxiClean, now for your media!
overview: OxiClean for your media library - cleans up those tough symlink stains!

versions.changelog:
Version 3.2.1 - Improve List Symlinks API Response
- Add SymlinkNames string array to list symlinks response for easy client parsing
- Add descriptive Message field to list symlinks response
- Clients can now easily access just the filenames without parsing full symlink objects
- Improved API documentation with structured response examples

Version 3.2.0 - Add Directory Management API
- Add POST /api/oxicleanarr/directories/create endpoint for explicit directory creation
- Add DELETE /api/oxicleanarr/directories/remove endpoint for directory removal
- Directory creation still auto-falls back during symlink creation (existing behavior preserved)
- Allows OxiCleanarr to explicitly manage directory lifecycle when needed
- Improved documentation with new directory management endpoints

Version 3.1.1 - Make status endpoint publicly accessible
- Status endpoint (/api/oxicleanarr/status) no longer requires authentication
- Allows health checks and version queries without admin credentials

Version 3.1.0 - Code Quality & Architecture Improvements
- Implement dependency injection with IPluginServiceRegistrator
- Add comprehensive code quality analyzers (StyleCop, SerilogAnalyzer, MultithreadingAnalyzer)
- Create .editorconfig and jellyfin.ruleset for code standards
- Add CI workflow for automated testing
- Centralize version management with Directory.Build.props
- Apply class-level admin authorization to all endpoints

Version 3.0.0 - MAJOR REBRAND
- Rebranded from Prunarr Bridge to OxiCleanarr Bridge
- API endpoints changed: /api/prunarr/* → /api/oxicleanarr/*
- All namespaces updated to Jellyfin.Plugin.OxiCleanarr
- Billy Mays-themed configuration page
- Same powerful symlink management features

Version 2.0.0 - BREAKING CHANGES
- Simplified to symlink-only design (Single Responsibility Principle)
- Removed Virtual Folder management
- Removed library scanning
- Renamed endpoints: /leaving-soon/* → /symlinks/*
- Removed /clear endpoint (use /remove for each item)
- Added /symlinks/list endpoint
- Removed AutoCreateVirtualFolder configuration
- Removed VirtualFolderName configuration

Version 1.0.3
- Updated to .NET 9.0 and Jellyfin 10.11.2
- Automated manifest updates with JPRM

Version 1.0.4
- Updated to .NET 9.0 and Jellyfin 10.11.2
- Automated manifest updates with JPRM

Version 1.0.3
- Updated to .NET 9.0 and Jellyfin 10.11.2
- Automated manifest updates with JPRM

Fixed plugin registration
- Added missing configuration page HTML file
- Plugin now properly appears in Jellyfin plugin list
- Configuration UI now available with API key, symlink path, and virtual folder settings

Initial release
- HTTP API endpoints for managing 'Leaving Soon' items
- Automatic Virtual Folder creation and management
- Symlink creation for media files
- API key authentication
- Support for movies, TV shows, and mixed collections
